question.title: Invalid Token in Java
question.body:
I'm a new Java programmer diving into learning Classes/Methods. It seems like i've typed this code correctly but Java is throwing an error on the final class curly bracket (actual error says 'Syntax error on token '}',delete this token'). I've tried removing it, adding another one, cut and pasting the class's variables and methods into a new set of curly braces. I can't figure it out. Can someone tell me if there's something I'm missing on this? When I tried to inset the code into the code snippet tool -- it broke up the text and I had to manually fix it. Could this be at the heart of the problem somehow?

    package Launch;

class Fruit {
    private String name;
    private String color;
    private String shape;

    public void setName(String name) {
        this.name = name;
    }

    public void setColor(String color) {
        this.color = color;
    }

    public void setShape(String shape) {
        this.shape = shape;
    }
}

    



    public static void main(String[] args) {

        Fruit fruit1 = new Fruit();
        fruit1.setName("Apple");
        fruit1.setColor("Red");
        fruit1.setShape("Oval");

        System.out.println(fruit1.name + " " + fruit1.color + " " + fruit1.shape);

    }

answers.body:
Rewrite the code as follows:

package Launch;

class Fruit {
    private String name;
    private String color;
    private String shape;

    public void setName(String name) {
        this.name = name;
    }

    public void setColor(String color) {
        this.color = color;
    }

    public void setShape(String shape) {
        this.shape = shape;
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {  // 👈 The `main` method nested within a class. 

        Fruit fruit1 = new Fruit();
        fruit1.setName("Apple");
        fruit1.setColor("Red");
        fruit1.setShape("Oval");

        System.out.println(fruit1.name + " " + fruit1.color + " " + fruit1.shape);

    }
}

Explanation: main() method must be enclosed inside the class Fruit.

question_comments.body: I see what I did now.   I had several days of learning how to write the main and doing all the exercises before getting to classes and methods.   I got tunnel vision on the basics when looking to a more complicated subject.   From now on, I'm going to try breaking the 2nd class off into a separate file to help keep the formatting straight in my mind - I think that'll help.   Thanks for the feedback from everyone.
Before posting here, study The Java Tutorials provided free-of-cost by Oracle.
A typo? Your main method isn't inside of a class.

79575836.body: Thanks for the assistance.  This didn't solve my issue (I actually needed to create a 2nd class named 'App' that lived outside of the class fruit) but it got me thinking about the formatting errors I made.   It was tunnel vision + brain drain.   Your response got me moving in the right direction though --- thanks again.
